solution_line_template: There are {num_reps} reps and they will work {hours_per_day} hour days so that's {num_reps}*{hours_per_day} = <<{num_reps}*{hours_per_day}={total_daily_hours}>>{total_daily_hours} hours
They will work {num_days} days a week so that's {num_days}*{total_daily_hours} = <<{num_days}*{total_daily_hours}={total_hours_over_period}>>{total_hours_over_period} hours

Each worker will be paid ${hourly_wage} an hour and in {num_days} days they will have worked {total_hours_over_period} hours so that's {hourly_wage}*{total_hours_over_period} = $<<{hourly_wage}*{total_hours_over_period}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}
